I think this show was right on the money for me . I watched it over the plane but there were no moments where I was bored or wanted to change it to something else. The plot was engaging and had just the right mix of humor and suspense to keep my attention throughout. The characters were well-developed and the chemistry between them felt genuine. Furthermore, the acting was superb and I enjoyed seeing a variety of fresh faces along with some more established actors. Overall, it provided the perfect escape during my flight and I'd highly recommend it to others looking for some quality entertainment.

Warning--this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story is all about was indeed a fine Korean painter who rose up from the lowest depths to become their greatest painter. Unfortunately, in so many ways, this guy was also a jerk in so many ways. Some of this was the artistic temperament and what may have seemed annoying was just his demanding nature when it came to art. But, other times he was simply a drunk jerk--especially when he was on his way to becoming a great artist.

Duchess and her three kittens are enjoying the high life with their devoted human mistress until the wicked butler Edgar decides to secretly remove them from the picture. Dreaming of inheriting his mistress's wealth, Edgar cruelly abandons the feline family in the distant countryside. Amidst perils and challenges, the Duchess and her kittens start their adventure to find their way back home. During the journey, they are helped by a charming tomcat named O'Malley and an eclectic group of animal friends. United, the animals discover the power of friendship and ultimately foil Edgar's scheme, safeguarding their beloved mistress's fortune and securing their place in her heart.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts. But it will put you close to being in a time and place that no longer exist by getting to the *feeling*.As Keith Richards remarks in Paul McCartney's movie about Holly, there's some Buddy Holly in almost all rock made since his day. The tragedy that took him is dealt with gently, and the rest of the movie recreates the joy of a great music career and a joyful body of music.Gary Busey does a remarkable, energetic portrayal of Holly, and his performances hint that he really gets into the music.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety , my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of art don't receive the recognition they deserve. Often, the hidden gems reveal complex emotions and themes, offering audiences a rare chance for introspection and enlightenment. While not an obvious crowd-pleaser, the understated mastery of its cinematography and the raw acting talent that transcends mere screen presence deserve to be praised. Such creative endeavours teach us not to overlook works just because they might not appeal to mainstream popularity but instead seek depth, authenticity, and provoke intelligent conversations on meaningful aspects of our society.

My favorite show of all time ! Yeah , I thought this was so cool , and Larisa Oleynik was absolutely amazing as Alex Mack! I couldn't wait for each new episode to see her supernatural adventures unfold while dealing with everyday teenage life. Her telekinetic and morphing abilities kept me intrigued, and her relatable struggles made me feel like I could face my own problems with a little bit of Alex's courage. I wish they still made shows like this today, as it was such a perfect balance of supernatural drama and heartfelt storytelling.

`` Pearl Harbor , buddy . '' This movie is brilliant ! Sure it does n't exactly flow like an Academy Award winner, but it doesn't need to! Pearl Harbor is a perfect mix of historical events, romance, and heart-pounding action. The breathtaking cinematography paired with a star-studded cast featuring Ben Affleck, Kate Beckinsale, and Josh Hartnett truly make this movie shine. While some may argue that it isn't entirely historically accurate, it offers viewers an emotional connection to one of the most significant moments in history. This war epic does justice to the sacrifices made by countless heroes and offers an engaging experience to cherish.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre . Set in Switzerland, the story follows a series of brutal murders connected to a mysterious music box, which slowly unravels a deep-seated darkness lying beneath the beautiful locales. The characters find themselves entrenched in a world where gruesome and twisted killings are connected to forgotten secrets. Although lacking the excess bloodletting that would later come to characterize Fulci's career, this early work presents a well-crafted tale of suspense, atmospheric terror, and a solid mystery, punctuated with intense kills and brilliant direction.

Just as in `` Columbo '' we see the fatality occur right at the beginning . What follows is an intriguing and captivating journey of piecing together the puzzle of who the culprit is. With brilliant detective work, clever twists, and intriguing characters, the story unfolds in a way that keeps the viewer engaged from beginning to end. Similar to the genius of Columbo's sharp observation skills, our protagonists employ unconventional and innovative tactics, unearthing truths that even the culprit themselves did not know would be found. Each piece of evidence slowly but surely seals the fate of the cunning and unsuspected villain.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something , and who appreciate a farce that is clever and witty, look no further than this brilliant concoction of humor and satire. Entertaining and thought-provoking, the engaging characters and perfectly timed absurdity of the story deliver a comedy that touches on both social and personal issues while not taking itself too seriously. Drenched in irony and sprinkled with puns, the witty banter delights and transports the audience into a world where laughter reigns supreme. So prepare to immerse yourself in this captivating farce – because cleverly crafted comedy is indeed worth the dialogue.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one ! I watched the movie without any expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised. The visuals and cinematography are stunning, and the performances of the actors are outstanding. Lee has effectively used the 3D technology, immersing the viewers in an enchanting world, transporting us to an entirely different realm. Moreover, the storyline and narrative structure are gripping and profound. It perfectly blends themes of love, hope, spirituality, and adventure, capturing the audience's heart from start to finish.

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series was coming to a close and the group was near break up. Their inventive and comedic series (sort of an American Idol of their day) took four unknown actors and formed a manufactured supergroup around them.This is their take on their "manufactured image" and status as the 2nd tier Beatles. They always felt they were in a box, trapped, and unable to find credibility despite their talents.It is also a hell of a musical-trippy, inventive (I have the soundtrack) and full of surprises.See it with an open mind.

This is a well directed Columbo episode , with also some good character but the story just does n't really grab your attention like some other classics do. The pacing can be a bit slow at times, which makes the viewer's mind wander rather than staying hooked on the intricate mystery. Nevertheless, Peter Falk, as always, delivers an excellent performance as Lieutenant Columbo, which somewhat compensates for the storyline. It is intriguing to watch him interact with different suspects and his attention to detail. The cinematography and use of Los Angeles landscapes add to the visuals of the show.

I ca n't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I 've described it to my friends during parties and get-togethers. It's simply amazing how certain moments can leave a long-lasting impact and bring endless joy. Whether it be a catchy phrase from a famous sitcom or a brilliantly-delivered joke by a beloved stand-up comedian, these magical moments have the power to bring people together in fits of laughter, brighten the gloomiest of days, and instantly light up conversations among strangers. Truly, such wittiness serves as a uniting thread of shared memories that will be cherished forever.

I do n't usually comment on films since I am in the movie distribution business , but I have to make an exception for the latest release I came across, which blew me away. This thought-provoking and mesmerizing masterpiece offers a rich combination of mind-bending plot, unforgettable performances, and visually stunning scenes. As an industry insider, it's a pleasure to encounter a movie that pushes boundaries and stands out among the mainstream flicks that tend to flood the market. I am thrilled to be a part of its distribution, and I can't recommend this hidden gem enough for both cinephiles and casual moviegoers alike.

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot. Some dude named Gerald breaks his engagement to Kitty and runs off to Craven Castle in Scotland. After several months Kitty and her aunt venture off to Scottland. Arriving at Craven Castle Kitty finds that Gerald has aged and he has grown meaner. Gerald has certain rules for the castle(the rules have been the same for 200 years). Gerald does not want them to stay but, Kitty insist on staying by making excuses. One night her aunt catches a glimpse of the monster running across the hall.

In the first transformation scene, what is the music? I've heard it was "The Greeks Don't Get No Freeks". Is that right? I really liked that sound. I also liked the "Hyde's Got Nothing to Hide" in the final scenes. Truly a doper movie, but with many laughs and puns, sight gags, and slapstick. Madam Woo-Woo's place was reminiscent of some places I have visited myself. Ivy Venus has appeared in some other stuff that is truly amazing. She looks much different in the movie we're talking about, but her maturity didn't hurt her a bit.

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film ! Hat 's off to Ben Daniels , Lavinia Currier and the entire cast and crew for bringing this masterpiece to life. The captivating narrative, stunning visuals, and the phenomenal performances by the actors have left an indelible impression on the audience. The film's attention to detail and its perfect blend of emotions and actions only amplify its charm. It is heartwarming to see such stories told through the medium of cinema, providing a platform for diverse voices and cultures. This is truly a must-watch film that takes you on an emotional roller-coaster and resonates deep within one's soul.

*Could contain spoilers, read only after seeing last episode season 2* Think about it. The guys on the north pole? Center of the earth? Looking for abnormal magnetic behavior? They also said something about: "did we miss it again?" So there was another abnormality? Of course that was when the plain crashed! I think this whole Island is a setup. Set up by her daddy. She found out about it and is looking for her Desmond. How else can she know what to look for.So basically it's an Island in a magnetic shield.

`` Live Together , Die Alone '' is divided into three main story lines , and each one of them explores a unique theme focused on the interdependence of individuals, relationships, and societal dynamics. The first storyline revolves around a tight-knit group of friends whose bond becomes severely tested when faced with conflicting individual aspirations and external pressures, ultimately proving the value of companionship over solitary pursuits. In the second story, a couple navigates the trials of marriage and raising children, with each partner having to rely on the other's strength in the face of life's inevitable adversities and setbacks.

"Live Together, Die Alone" is divided into three main story lines, and each one of them alone would have been enough for a great episode. So when you put all of them together, you have a great ^ 3 episode. It was a daring move to give the flashbacks of a season finale to a character (Desmond) who had only appeared in 3 episodes up to that point, but it worked: his backstory is absolutely fascinating to watch, both informative about the past of the island & the Swan station itself and honestly moving.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old . I had no idea who Buddy Holly was or what his significance was in the music industry, but something about the film struck a chord with me. Maybe it was the infectious energy of Gary Busey's portrayal or the catchy tunes, but I quickly became captivated. As I grew older, my appreciation for Buddy Holly and his contributions to the world of rock and roll only increased. From his unique guitar playing style to his influential songwriting, I began to realize how impactful this tragically short-lived artist was to both his contemporaries and future musicians.

i love this film!! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is talking about and means to do. it kept me laughing for the duration. duration of the film, the next day, and beyond. i think this film is not one to watch if you mainly care about the plot and character development. this film is pretty much only for the generation that will understand it. there are lots of things you just know being brought up in that generation that you wouldn't if you were say 40. i think Sacha barren Cohen was Very and i do mean Very good.

My favorite show of all time! Yeah, I thought this was so cool, and Larisa Oleynik was the first crush I ever had (AAAAWWWWWW). It was well written, funny-except when it it wanted to be serious, and just a great show overall. But since we couldn't afford to keep Nick, I couldn't see any episodes after Feb. 1996, and maybe that makes me think more of the show than I should. To me it's more the epidemy (now that doesn't look spelled right!)

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 "They Made Me a Criminal." Celebrating a ring victory in a jammed locker room, boxer Johnnie Bradfield emotes about his love of mom, rejection of booze and clean living style to fans, including cops, who eat it up. Later in the evening he's plowed and tussling with his bimbo gal while his manager, in on the con, shares the evening. And the whiskey.A problem develops when another couple arrives. The guy is a newspaper reporter and he says he'll expose Bradfield's phony life on the front page.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I've ever seen on film. I don't know if it's as serious as it seems to try to be, but that hardly matters. This film is extreme, absolutely wild and surreal. The packaging and the marketing only make it more so because you *know* that ever so often some mother has to reprogram her kid to accept our reality after he checks this out from the video store expecting something completely different. Look at the roadmap, for one thing!

What an excellent movie , made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it completely by chance. While browsing through streaming options on a cozy weekend night, the captivating plot of this hidden gem instantly grabbed our attention. From the very start, we were deeply immersed in its outstanding storytelling and exceptional character development. The enthralling plot twists kept us glued to the edge of our seats while the visuals were nothing short of spectacular. Rarely do you find a movie that lingers on your mind long after it's over, but this cinematic treasure will surely resonate with us for years to come.

Without going into any details of a good...if a somewhat provocative...TV movie, there seems to be a consensus among the users that there is "no one to blame here".I disagree. Yes, the young male lover of Beverly D'Angelo, played by Rob Estes may be young and horny (and good looking) because he's not getting as much as he wants from mom, that doesn't mean, he can climb in bed and have sex with daughter. OK, he can use the excuse he just wanted to watch TV with her, but I don't buy it.

"Showtime" falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying, and a little south of what I expected months ago when I first heard about Eddie Murphy and Robert Di Niro teaming up for a comedy. Overall, it was pretty good! As "real life" crime or cops go-- and plot, for that matter-- it is pretty illogical, but DUH--- this is a comedy. Also, while the special effects, chases, aerial shots, and skyscrapers blowing up were present but lower key than a Schwartzenegger movie, I found it a bit tiresome and overdone.

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost ( for many years ) gem , I strongly recommend seizing the opportunity. This long-lost treasure has recently resurfaced, bringing with it a wave of excitement and nostalgia among its devoted followers. Its contents, an amalgamation of vintage photographs, enigmatic symbols, and spellbinding tales, will instantly transport you to a bygone era, stirring long-forgotten emotions and memories. The meticulously crafted narratives hidden within will not only captivate and fascinate, but also serve as a testament to our cultural history.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie . I am not saying this lightly . I understand that it may not be everyone's cup of tea, and that's perfectly fine. We all have different tastes when it comes to entertainment. What resonated with me might not resonate with someone else, and that's what makes our opinions so unique and valuable. For me, the movie's storytelling and character development hit just the right chords, offering a delightful blend of comedy, emotion, and action. The visuals were also quite impressive, keeping me thoroughly captivated.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I was beyond excited when her daytime talk show premiered. Not only does Rachael showcase her love for cooking and share some incredible recipes on the show, but she also highlights various aspects of lifestyle and home tips that viewers can easily adopt into their own lives. Furthermore, the celebrity interviews and guest appearances add a fun element of surprise to each episode, and Rachael's warm and relatable demeanor makes her connect instantly with her guests and viewers alike.

`` Hari om '' is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name "Hari Om" is an Indian greeting that invokes a divine presence, as well as the compelling title character of the film of the same name. The story revolves around Hari, a young man seeking a journey of self-discovery and purpose in life. Alongside a group of characters, all from different backgrounds and each with their own dilemmas, they collectively search for answers about identity and meaning. With its emotive storytelling and colorful visuals, the film effortlessly portrays a powerful representation of spiritual exploration in modern times.

I really enjoyed this film , it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat . It was very suspenseful and had some unexpected twists and turns throughout the storyline. The acting was superb, with the cast perfectly portraying the emotions and struggles of their characters. The cinematography was excellent, providing some breathtaking and memorable visuals. The musical score greatly added to the tension and atmosphere of the film. Overall, this film is highly recommended for anyone looking for an engaging and captivating cinematic experience. A must-watch thriller that won't leave you disappointed!

The Monkees , surprisingly , are a big favorite of mine . Yes , they might have been the original "manufactured" band, assembled for a television show rather than for their musical prowess, but they still managed to produce some absolute gems of catchy, melodic pop music. Despite their contrived beginnings, they broke the mold and transcended their limitations to develop a unique, genuine sound that still resonates with fans today. Their evergreen hits, such as "Daydream Believer" and "I'm a Believer," have managed to stand the test of time and can bring a smile to even the most cynical face.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time . Then I bought the video and watched it countless times since. Each viewing revealed new details and deepened my appreciation for the film. The story, the acting, and the visuals were nothing short of amazing. Not to mention the profound impact the movie's message had on me. Eventually, I started recommending it to friends and family, and hosted movie nights so that they could also experience its greatness. Over the years, this once PBS-special transformed into an absolute classic that always manages to inspire meaningful conversations and personal reflections for everyone who watches it.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.T his heartwarming tale follows their incredible adventures as they try to find their way back home. Along the way, they encounter a diverse cast of colorful characters, each with their unique quirks, all providing memorable moments and adding charm to the storyline. Not only is the plot engaging and captivating, but the brilliant animation, perfectly-chosen soundtrack, and skilled voice acting work in tandem to make this an unforgettable cinematic experience for audiences of all ages.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall the movie is effective very effective it makes you question and leaves you thinking the story is kinda far fetched but is believable and makes you feel good in sequences, its not like its the usual done and tried path. the characters are pretty well defined and are convincing. Justin long stands out among all the others and watch out for his speech in the end he will convince anyone with that speech he is simply brilliant in that speech.

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

Another go round with the monkey king going west....sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie just goes from the first frame onward.A monk and his three disciples go to a town to get the sacred suras that will bring peace to the world once they are translated and spoken to the world.But an evil force has intervened and kidnapped all of the children of the town. The evil force wants the monk because if you eat him you will live forever. The retainers battle the forces of darkness before forcibly sending the monk off for safety (The monk thinks he can win simply by reasoning with the bad guys).

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol ' says it all . I used to watch this show religiously and it never failed to make me laugh out loud. The blend of quirky characters, unique plotlines, and well-timed humor created an enjoyable viewing experience that kept me coming back for more. Not to mention, the chemistry between the cast was on point – it’s evident that they had fun making this show, and it reflected positively onscreen. Over time, this show has maintained its wit, charm, and ability to tickle our funny bones.

I don't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch while I did. I got so engrossed I gave up working to just sit and finish watching the last half hour uninterrupted. And I sure don't usually shed tears over this sort of show, but I was crying at the end. A lot of emotional nuance. Great acting, and good southern feel. John Corbett is one of the most talented actors out there, and the guy who played Luke was really good too. Highly recommend.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman : TAS and its ilk , I enjoyed it in spite of my initial skepticism. Gargoyles seamlessly combines elements of adventure, mystery, and fantasy while presenting complex characters and storylines that engage both younger and adult audiences alike. The beautifully dark animation style, coupled with fantastic voice acting, elevates the experience and leaves you wanting more. Exploring themes of loyalty, redemption, and family dynamics, Gargoyles stands as an exceptional example of well-executed 90s animation, defying age and transcending genres.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in! I love watching him!! i was 10 yrs old (1979) when i seen him for the first time.i eagerly await each and everything he'll be acting in. hopefully one day i can see him in person. he's very hypnotic and mysterious and that voice is commanding and strong! he is very attractive, even now at 65 he is absolutely stunning!!!! In my opinion he is the greatest actor iv'e ever seen!

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and, by the process, their own lives are not that uncommon. Also not uncommon are results that reflect lack of talent, a failure of introspection, an abundance of narcissism and, perhaps, an unsubtle quest for publicly-splashed revenge for countless past hurts, real and fantasized. What is unusual is a brilliant, fair and engrossing portrait of a fascinating parent and "My Architect: A Son's Journey" is that rare achievement.Louis Kahn emigrated to this country as a child, his face irreparably and brutally scarred by an accident.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time, when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series again and again in re-runs and complete on DVD. I find the New Outer Limits WELL MORE than just a remake of old retread episodes, as some of the more adolescent commentators have suggested.With seven (7) years of programs versus just the two (2) years of the original series, the producers and writers have certainly added considerable new original stories and philosophical lines to a much longer running and very well produced (cable) TV series.

Easily Lucio Fulci 's most respected film , `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is highly renowned for it s unflinching exploration of brutal subject matter and atmospheric tension. Fulci masterfully combines themes of superstition, religious mania, and the inherent cruelty present in human nature, resulting in a unique and often harrowing cinematic experience. This 1972 Italian giallo is elevated by the striking cinematography and unforgettable performances, leaving an indelible impact on its viewers. The film is drenched in vivid visuals, adept storytelling, and expert pacing, cementing "Don't Torture a Duckling" as an essential and exemplary entry in the annals of Italian horror.

I've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was in it as well didn't give Me the best impression of the film .... then to be dragged to the cinema by a group of my friends and sit there expecting a pile of pants i was shocked to find that i was scared stiff all the way through the film ... it was predictable yes but the build up of the deaths and the whole atmosphere of the film made it REALLY scary for me ... i was watching through my fingers the whole way through.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a bucket load of gore lead to him earning the title 'The Godfather of Gore'. While Don't Torture a Duckling was made before Fulci became well known amongst gorehounds, and isn't all that gory; it's certainly a gritty and nasty little thriller, and for my money - the best film that Fulci ever made! Don't Torture a Duckling really is head and shoulders above a lot of the Giallo genre in terms of production values and unlike many of Fulci's later films, everything about this Giallo is great.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC. I've been looking for it ever since. It was haunting: visual, textural, sensual. This movie took me somewhere like a dream and I didn't care where. I will never forget the curtain blowing in the breeze. I still remember the way it made me tilt my head. I remember my facial expression when I saw it. I didn't know what had happened when the movie was over, but I find life is that way. It didn't bother me.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on Earth. It delves into the mysteries of the deep, offering glimpses into the captivating lives of the ocean's diverse inhabitants, while also examining the current state and conservation efforts of marine ecosystems. With immersive storytelling, the audience can expect to feel the drama, tension, and fascination that life beneath the waves possesses. Spectacular imagery, alongside compelling narratives, showcases not just the abundance and beauty of marine life, but also underscores the importance of protecting our fragile oceans for future generations to appreciate and explore.

My impression , having seen this documentary , is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had before he started the film. As Kahn delves deeper into his father's life and work, he discovers numerous layers and complexities in both the artist and the man that were hidden or neglected. The viewer also embarks on a fascinating journey of art, human relationships, self-identity, and introspection. We learn how powerful architectural works can shape our existence, and how intertwined the artist's personality is with the very fabric of the space they design.

'Captain Corelli 's Mandolin ' is a fantastic film in itself . It is nothing like the book , which is far more detailed and intricate in its plot and characters. The movie, however, is a beautiful adaptation that brings to life the breathtaking landscapes of Greece and captures the essence of love, war, and sacrifice in the 1940s. While the film deviates significantly from the book, it creates a strong visual spectacle that pulls at your heartstrings. Led by Nicolas Cage and Penélope Cruz's brilliant performances, the powerful storytelling captures a romantic whirlwind amidst the backdrop of war, chaos, and loss.

A Formula For Murder is n't a well known Giallo , but that is n't to say it 's not a captivating watch for fans of the genre. Directed by Alberto De Martino, this lesser-known gem combines intriguing murder-mystery elements with classic gory, stylistic trademarks of Italian horror cinema. A prime example of a Giallo, A Formula for Murder succeeds in surprising audiences with shocking twists and chilling revelations. Released in 1985, the film is beautifully shot with a score that evokes tension and heightens the dread experienced by viewers. It's worth tracking down this unique and atmospheric cult classic to uncover its sinister secrets for yourself.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it . That would be fine if the story and character development were at least somewhat compelling, but sadly they fall short in comparison. The stunning visuals are often juxtaposed against a weak plot, leaving the viewer with a bittersweet cinematic experience. The talented ensemble cast gives it their all, attempting to infuse life into two-dimensional characters; however, the weak script leaves little room for them to shine. Moreover, the movie's pacing and storyline can be somewhat uneven, making for a frustrating watch.

As with so many modern US films, there has to be a supernatural element to the plot, but if you just let that go, this is a tale with heaps of charm and a kindly heart cased in a crab shell.We are presented with a scene of a town in an economically depressed area struggling to find anything to be happy about. Beau Bridges' character is really up against it with a family on the increase, a nil bank balance and a brother-in-law who's sold out to a big business chain which he secretly hates, but in which he is willing to rub Beau's nose.

My impression, having seen this documentary, is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had before he made the film. He took five years to make it, a labour of love and longing. I can only imagine the turmoil of the editing process, what to leave in, what to take out. His father, the renowned architect Louis Kahn,comes across as a man too selfish and self-absorbed to be emotionally available to even one wife not alone three. But like many men of his character, he attracted women who were spellbound by the remoteness and entranced by the creativity.

This is a wonderful movie , and I still love it ! It just so magical and it is fun to watch it again and again. The captivating story, enchanting characters, and mesmerizing soundtrack have this incredible way of pulling you into the magical world it has created. Each scene unfolds with so much emotion and excitement that you find yourself totally engrossed and unable to look away. The unexpected plot twists keep you guessing throughout, adding to the thrill of the movie-watching experience. Furthermore, the rich visual effects and vibrant cinematography only enhance the fantastical atmosphere.

I loved this film, which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival. In March 2005 I went to India with 2 friends, and this movie was very real. I related to everything, and savored every moment. The characters are believable, the story poignant and the ending realistic, but not sentimental. I also enjoyed the discussion with the director after the showing. This movie shows very well the blending, but not complete mixing of 2 worlds (East and West). The supporting cast was wonderful, depicting the life a tourist encounters in India quite realistically.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918 , a doughboy who can not seem to get the hang of military life. Despite his clumsy nature and perpetual misunderstandings, he quickly becomes a fan favorite among his fellow soldiers. He takes them on comedic misadventures, leaving laughter and chaos in his wake. As Chaplin and his comrades navigate the challenging realities of World War I, the slapstick antics give way to heartwarming camaraderie, bringing much-needed relief and cheer to their bleak surroundings. With luck on his side, this lovable doughboy ultimately leads his crew to an improbable and morale-boosting victory, solidifying their everlasting bond.

This little film is hysterical , full of stereotypes about gays , straights , dwarfs , British tea and pubs This little film is an absolute riot, incorporating stereotypes about gays, straights, dwarfs, and classic British tea and pub culture that provide for both cringe-worthy and laugh-out-loud moments. The exaggerated portrayal of each group will have you questioning societal norms, while also fostering a sense of camaraderie amongst these seemingly mismatched characters. Clever humor is sprinkled throughout the movie as misunderstandings pile up and hilarity ensues. In all, it is an irreverent comedy that tests the boundaries while making you belly laugh until the very end.

Always enjoyed `` DOA '' ,1950 , which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film . Dennis Quaid's modern version brings a unique touch to this noir classic. The intriguing storyline is well-suited to Quaid's charisma and intensity as the protagonist. A strong supporting cast, featuring Charlotte Rampling and Meg Ryan, adds depth to this mystery-thriller. The new setting, vivid cinematography, and stylized visual effects enhance the nostalgic vibe while successfully connecting the film to its era. Updated to cater to contemporary tastes, this adaptation is proof that classics can be reinvented while maintaining the elements that made them remarkable in the first place.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the rural community that surrounds them. Set amidst lush, rolling hills and with a quaint small-town charm, the cinematography is undeniably breathtaking, immersing the viewer into their world. Each frame brims with both depth and vibrancy. The simple, yet compelling narrative of human bonds and generational connections, allows us to connect emotionally with the protagonists. Showcasing authentic and heartfelt moments with delicately rendered, layered storytelling, this short film effectively encapsulates a powerful sense of homecoming, tradition, and an unbreakable sense of togetherness.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance , a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - all bundled into a captivating visual narrative. The film seamlessly weaves the war's gripping tension, sacrifices, and indomitable spirit with an engaging and heartfelt love story that transcends time. Characters are intricately developed, with their relationships showcasing human vulnerability and inner strength amidst the chaos of war. Furthermore, the fantasy elements not only entertain, but also provoke deep reflections about fate, loyalty, and sacrifice. This unforgettable combination creates a cinematic masterpiece that leaves viewers enthralled, deeply moved, and profoundly inspired.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! In 1933 Mae Questel caricatured Pitt's voice for the character Olive Oyl for the Fleischer Studios animated cartoon version of the comic strip Popeye. Zasu (pronounced Zay-Sue) does her best "Olive Oyl" impersonation walking around whining and ringing her hands or attaching herself to the policeman's laynard. I kept waiting for her to say "ohhh myyyy", but instead it's "something always happens to somebody." The first time I saw this film I loved Zasu and found her character really funny.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before, should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse' Although I prefer Ali G when he is interviewing the rich and famous, his brand of completely off the wall comedy definitely entertains from start to finish on the big screen too.Ridiculous plot, ridiculous characters and a ridiculous script, that all make this film a riot for fans of Ali G.If you've seen him and didn't like him then avoid this film like the plague, because it's definitely just more of the same; for everybody else - watch it Aiiii!

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy (Garlin) wandering around Chicago with an eye for every woman he sees. The laughs keep coming almost every minute. It's a somewhat dramatic and serious story about a man looking for love, but done with great comedic writing and acting. The supporting roles are also very well done and very funny and really make the movie rich.Rose Abdoo is hysterical in her receptionist role taking you right into the mood of the rest of the film. Sara Silverman is awesome with some of the great bits she does with Jeff.

Always enjoyed "DOA",1950,which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film. Dennis Quaid,(Dexter Cornell), was a professor who loved his wife and finally found out she was having an affair with one of his students. Dexter gets involved with Meg Ryan(Sydney Fuller), who was a student in his college class and at the same time had a big crush on him and wound up having a one night stand and in some ways loved him deeply. Dexter learns that he received a drink which had bad contents and would cause him a great deal of health problems!

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India, as he intricately weaves together a mesmerizing tapestry that explores the rich cultural heritage and diverse natural beauty of the nation. Through a seamless blend of evocative images and enchanting music, he transports viewers to a world filled with vibrant colors, captivating sounds, and a profound sense of spiritual oneness. Journey with us as we explore India's hidden gems – ancient temples, quaint rural villages, pulsating cities, and lush landscapes – in this hypnotic sojourn that awakens the soul and connects us all with our shared human experience.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo' (hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door'), and was very impressed by both it's dreamy & occasionally surreal tale of a family that immigrates from Sicially to the U.S. in the early days of the 20th century. It also worked as a (proverbial)middle finger jammed into the eyeball of Homeland Security (preferably all the way up to the 3rd knuckle),in it's depiction of the ill treatment of foreigners who just want a better life than they were getting from their original mother land.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people. The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of life's moral highway make interesting viewing. There seems to be a different standard of judgement on women who have extra marital affairs than on men. Amy Watson's hurtful and humiliating behaviour towards her husband seems to pass without comment. Reverse the roles and one could expect a torrent of condemnation towards the man. If she found her husband boring and judgmental she could could have told him so, left and waited for a no doubt large financial settlement upon divorce.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen! The images that are shown are absolutely breathtaking and stunning. On top of that, it is a wonderful learning experience. I'm not one for educational documentaries, but this one grabs hold of you and doesn't let go until the end. You'll be so hooked and entranced by what you are watching that you'll forget your at home watching TV! This series is available to buy on DVD and I HIGHLY recommend picking this one up!

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps your eyes wide open with mesmerizing views of pristine beaches, olive groves, and picturesque villages. Set in World War II, Captain Corelli's Mandolin weaves a touching love story amidst the horrors of war. This unique fusion of passion, history, and stunning visuals results in a delightful viewing experience that will captivate your heart while awakening your senses. Despite tackling sensitive subject matters, the film maintains a subtle romantic undertone, delicately evoking raw emotion while celebrating the enduring power of love and hope against all odds.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time. Top 20 of my lifetime. I laughed more than I have since Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and cried more than I have since I saw The Notebook. If you are looking for a touching movie without the sappy edge...this is the one. It is real and powerful. See it and you won't regret it. I was reluctant at first and I only watched it because I had to do a school project about speech disabilities. But this movie is so much more than that.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's packed with suspenseful mysteries and compelling characters, but the show also boasts exceptional storytelling and intricate plotlines that constantly surprise its viewers. Throughout the six seasons, the viewers become heavily invested in the personal growth of the diverse ensemble, making us feel as if we were a part of the unique island that changes everyone who enters it. Lost remains unforgettable due to its mind-bending twists, unforgettable scenery, and a powerful culmination of various mythologies that provide a distinctive touch to an extraordinary tale.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form . I tracked it down on VHS, which surprisingly contained the uncut version, and immediately fell in love with its raw and edgy storyline. Over time, the once-trusty VHS began to wear down, so when the DVD release was finally announced, I eagerly purchased it to relive the movie in its full glory. However, to my dismay, the DVD version reverted back to the same edited content as the old BBC1 airings. Frustrated, I held on to my worn-out VHS copy, continuing to cherish this masterpiece in its true, unabridged form.

I love this movie, though I don't like how they picture Egyptians, being an Egyptian citizen myself! that's why it earns an eight out of 10.The relationship between Augustin and the leopard is awkward, and of course because of loneliness and living in that cave for quite so long, he develops a kind of insanity and passion to that leopard.A very touching scene when the leopard dies, watch Augustin's reaction.. All in all I find it enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to reading the short story by Balzac.

This movie is true action at its finest , It does n't get any better then this . This is a must-watch for action enthusiasts, filled with non-stop adrenaline-pumping sequences, breathtaking stunts, and an exhilarating plot that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The lead character's transformation from an underdog to a fearsome force adds a layer of relatability, allowing us to cheer them on with unwavering support. Add to the mix the remarkable visual effects, nail-biting car chases, and compelling storytelling, this movie truly elevates the standard for the action genre.

Very touching film, a great surprise to come up from Brazil, a country that usually exports features about social themes, violence, sex... Magical realism is a very hard task, and I believe João Falcão has made it wonderfully. It seems that he really didn't intend to make a realistic film, far from that. Although many people think the film was adapted from the play, he said in his interviews that he actually based the film on the book. Another mistake is to think that Falcão has been influenced by the series "Hoje é Dia De Maria".

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time . Excellent original music , clever , heady ... it has it all! This masterpiece combines witty humor with unexpected plot twists, creating a remarkable experience for viewers of all ages. The incredible ensemble cast brings an impeccable comedic timing and strong on-screen chemistry, resulting in a never-ending cascade of laughter. With each passing scene, the film builds upon the eccentric storyline, making it even more amusing and thoroughly enjoyable. Filled with punchlines and hilarious situations, this movie will go down as a true comedic gem that stays in people's hearts for years to come.

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow . It accomplished this through the energetic performances of its lead actors, authentic portrayals of legendary musicians, and a gripping narrative that humanized the iconic band. The phenomenal cinematography captures the raw, chaotic energy of live performances and personal moments alike, while the timeless soundtrack enhances the emotional core of the story. Furthermore, the impeccable production design and exquisite costumes transport the audience to the era, seamlessly blending reality and artistic liberty. In exploring themes of love, fame, and identity, the film solidified its impact as a culturally relevant masterpiece.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen: much better and deeper than Luhrman's Romeo&Juliet or Spielberg's Titanic. Gerda's love impresses me every time, her search, her battle is exceptional. Gerda becomes a strong, loving woman throughout the movie. Kay is the poisoner of dark forces: the temptation. This story encourages me to fight like Gerda for the ONLY ONE, for the love of my life, for Mister Right. Patience is one of the keywords of this movie. I cry every time when I realize all the suffering of Gerda and Kay.

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere, strikes him down dead, and keeps driving. The rest of the film is spent discovering who hit him, why he was hit, and what consequences this murder will have on the rest of the village. Separate Lies is a very British movie indeed. I'm not saying that hit-and-run car accidents are a particularly British phenomenon, but the way everyone reacts to this tragedy is very British. Tom Wilkinson plays James Manning, a hard-working, respectable citizen with a "stiff-upper-lip" attitude towards tragedy.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you'll be hard-pressed. HEAD is a masterpiece of non-linear non-structure, surrealism and experimentaion. In less than 90 minutes, it manages to be not only a time-capsule of an era, but also a full-length experimental feature that defies time,space and convention in a way that only underground films of the sixties could.HEAD is a reflection of those films. No matter how one feels about the Monkees, this is a film every filmmaker should see because it cracks wide open the endless possibilities of film as an art medium.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly ( 1936-1959 ) is a tour de force for Gary Busey, who earned an Academy Award nomination for his powerful and transformative performance as Holly. Capturing the vibrant energy of the era and the enduring impact of Buddy Holly's tragically short yet highly influential musical career, this captivating biopic delves into the trials and triumphs he faced while rising to superstardom. Poignant and genuinely entertaining, "The Buddy Holly Story" stands as a heartfelt tribute to a true rock and roll pioneer and an enduringly resonant testament to his undeniably enduring cultural legacy.

I had heard of John Garfield, but, didn't know him. I loved this movie. I had never heard of it. I just picked it up randomly. John Garfield is a boxer in the movie. He had been in real life also so he knew his part. He was a fugitive throughout the movie. Someone else killed a man. He character was blamed. He is befriended by a family who has questions and is not quite sure what to make of him. All sorts of minor plots ensue.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

The revelation here is Lana Turner 's dancing ability . Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub dancer, the public rarely got a chance to witness this side of her talent. In this particular scene, Lana shines like never before as she shows off her flawless dance moves and impeccable rhythm. Her gracefulness, effortless elegance, and charming charisma light up the stage and leave the audience completely mesmerized. This unexpected showcasing of her dancing prowess reveals an untapped talent and adds another fascinating layer to her already impressive persona.

The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and if you follow its lead you're going to have a lot of fun (as long as you don't mind your murders served up really bloody, and your horror topped with extra cheese)!This film winks an eye at every horror fan, and then gives them the finger. It knows it sucks, and because of that, it's far and away the best of the "Child's Play" series. It plays up the "stoopid humor" angle so well, you find yourself doing more than just laughing AT it, but WITH it.

I always liked this movie, I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it :) the story is interesting and special. But the only thing I have to disagree with is that I don't think Max lived in a Romanian monastery or what was that :P They don't look that way in Romania.. Anyway, back to the story, Ghita Muresan played pretty well but as someone said before me, his English needs to improve. And there were some funny moments and some tragical/sad parts too. It worths being seen, I thought it was sweet that the giant wanted to find his love.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to the same laughter-induced torture. It's packed with witty one-liners, ridiculous scenes, and the most epic ensemble cast, delivering a fantastic dose of gut-busting, unapologetic comedy that will leave you in stitches. The fast-paced storyline weaves hilarity with clever pop culture references, forcing viewers to examine social absurdities and relate on a painfully comedic level. For those seeking an insanely amusing experience, gather up your crew for an unforgettable night of laughter-induced tears, popcorn warfare, and hilarious conversation that this ultimate comedy flick provokes.

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this tribute to his genius. I can picture him smiling down at us, giving a wink of approval as we continue to share the hilarity and wit he once created on Earth. Spike Milligan's legacy of laughter lives on, reaching new generations of fans and reminding us all of the healing power of humor in our everyday lives. Although the world has changed since his time, the comedic king left a mark so vivid and influential, it refuses to fade.

I loved this film ! ! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it on the big screen, and it did not disappoint. The plot was engaging, and the characters were well-developed, making the audience genuinely invested in their stories. The cinematography and visual effects were absolutely stunning, which further added to the immersive experience. Moreover, the film had a great balance of humor and emotion, tugging at your heartstrings while still managing to make you laugh. The soundtrack was on point as well, elevating each scene to new heights.

In Tweety's S.O.S, Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that happens to carry a certain canary bird-and Granny, his owner. Uh-Oh! Once again, Tweety and Granny provide many obstacles to the cat's attempts to get the bird. Sylvester also gets seasick quite a few times, too. And the second time the red-nosed feline goes to the place on the ship that has something that cures his ailments, Tweety replaces it with nitroglycerin. So now Sylvester can blow fire! I'll stop here and say this is another excellent cartoon directed by Friz Freling starring the popular cat-and-bird duo.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

`` Caribe '' is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects . However , it delivers a perfectly enjoyable experience with its lush visuals, enticing settings, and strong performances from its cast. This film takes audiences on a colorful adventure across the Caribbean islands, showcasing its unique charm and local culture along the way. The well-rounded characters are what make Caribe compelling to watch despite its less than exceptional narrative. Throughout their journey, viewers become invested in the ups and downs of their stories, celebrating triumphs and empathizing with struggles.

`` A Slight Case of Murder '' is an excellent TV movie , which is defiantly worth the price of admission. Based on the thrilling mystery novel by Donald E. Westlake, the film is expertly adapted for the small screen and delivers a superb blend of intrigue, suspense, and humor. Starring the versatile William H. Macy as a once-popular mystery writer struggling to clear his name after being framed for a series of gruesome killings, the film unravels a twist-filled narrative that will keep audiences glued to their screens. Supporting performances from Felicity Huffman and Adam Arkin only add to the gripping drama that makes this cinematic gem an absolute must-see.

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man who becomes obsessed with the supernatural. Set in a creepy, old mansion, it expertly utilizes shadows, camera angles, and unnerving sounds to create an unsettling environment. The man's obsession slowly consumes his sanity as he digs deeper into the realm of the unknown, often encountering horrifying spirits and hauntings along the way. The film brilliantly blends suspenseful, slow-building terror with nerve-wracking surprises that continually question the viewer's perception of reality.

"D.O.A" is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish. Dennis Quaid is at his caustic best; and Quaid is sadly one of the most underused talents in Hollywood. His then beau Meg Ryan also appears with him, but as is usually the case, doesn't really make much of an impact. The film is stylishly directed throughout, drawing on a number of influences to capture its 'seamy' feel. Would you credit that it's actually directed by two people? The answer is no. The whole thing is superbly slick, from its innovative camerawork to its unabashed use of black and white photography.

I don't care what some of the reviews said, this movie was funny. The thing with this film is that you can't expect anything else except to be entertained. This is not some intellectual comedy, this is a clever popcorn movie. The three main cast members are great and work very well with each other. Shatner is a standout in the supporting cast as himself, a former TV cop, brought in by Russo's character to coach the cops on how to be "TV cops." Those are by far the funniest scenes.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard (Beau Travail), Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that follows the journey of a peasant family from their primitive home in Sicily to Ellis Island in New York at the turn of the century. It is a surreal, enigmatic, often strange, but ultimately deeply rewarding experience. Interweaving dreamlike and symbolic imagery with gritty realism, the latest film by Emanuele Crialese (Respiro) is like an impressionistic painting - a cinematic artist's rendering of what the immigration process may have been like for our parents and grandparents.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread. Louis de Berniere's bestselling novel is one of my favourites and anyone who has read it will realise that there is no way in hell that any screen adaptation can be 100% faithful. All the way through I found myself convincing myself that the movie was unsuccessful, and had stripped the book's plot back so far as to render it redundant. The ending, however, is much better than that in the novel, and I could not stop thinking about the movie afterwards.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is going through in the movie. The story, the characters, and the humor all resonate so deeply with me. The soundtrack is an absolute delight, as well! The chemistry between the actors is really something to be admired, and it genuinely adds a layer of authenticity to the overall experience. If you haven't watched it yet, do yourself a favor and give it a chance. I guarantee that you won't be disappointed!

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen, However, I am only in the second season.The typical Columbo activities are both amusing and irritating. His cigar ashes causing him trouble have been seen before, And the bit where he always identifies in some way with the murderer--in this case cooking ,Tho the scene on the TV cooking show distracted from the main theme.Also not explained was why the brother at the beginning of the show was cutting part of the wires of the mixer. The reason was never explained ,nor did it serve any purpose.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004 's Academy Awards , My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to uncover the enigmatic legacy of his late father, renowned architect Louis Kahn. Delving into the man's work, personal life, and his father's secrets, Nathaniel creates an intimate portrait of the troubled artist. Embarking on a global exploration, the filmmaker visits iconic buildings, including the National Assembly Building in Bangladesh and the Salk Institute in California. The film brilliantly captures the universal themes of family, ambition, and perseverance.

Not a stunner, but a good movie to see once or twice. Bill Macy shows he can do more than just act; his writing was pretty darn good. Great supporting cast, especially Jamie Cromwell as the extortionist private eye.The movie's greatest strength is the work of Macy, who reminds us of his Jerry Lundergaard role from Fargo. He has numerous scenes where he is extremely funny as a slimy, manipulating and deceitful character. It's enjoyable to watch him be a weasel, and for a while I was happy that things were turning out well for him.

This Oscar-winning short film (40 minutes), based on a short story by William Faulkner, takes us back to small-town Tennessee in December 1941. Two brothers, one about 18 and one about 8 are looking for birds eggs (obviously a huge collectors item for boys in the South around this time). Well, the Japanese bomb Pearl Harbor and the older brother, Pete, decides to enlist. He gives his prize egg to his little brother, Willie and heads off wishing to show more emotion and tenderness to his little acolyte.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the cast, it truly makes for a remarkable on-screen ensemble. Their chemistry and undeniable talent take viewers on an unforgettable cinematic journey, enthralling us with their every move. Their skilled performances undoubtedly capture the essence of the characters they bring to life, revealing complexities and human emotion that resonate with audiences. Everett and Bassett lend incredible support and only further strengthen the foundation built by Watson and Wilkinson. A marvelous combination, their collective acting prowess promises a powerful, captivating experience that's not to be missed!

I 've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was in it, I must admit I was a bit skeptical at first. However, I decided to give it a chance and surprisingly, it wasn't as bad as I expected. Paris Hilton's performance, although not Oscar-worthy, was quite decent, and it added an interesting twist to the storyline. The movie as a whole was entertaining with a few intriguing twists and turns, and the pacing kept me engaged throughout.

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but overall, it was an enjoyable cinematic experience. The plot picked up seamlessly from where the previous installment left off, delivering intriguing twists, engaging character development, and exhilarating action sequences that kept the audience on the edge of their seats. Although a few continuity and narrative inconsistencies were noticeable, these minor issues did not detract from the film's entertainment value. The standout performances from the ensemble cast elevated the well-executed script and gave viewers the emotional connection needed in a successful sequel.

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local elections, nasty chancellor David Carlton (Charles Dance) hopes to discredit his party's current leader, thus enabling him to seize power. To his surprise, however, the plan backfires, Ali is embraced by the nation, and Carlton is forced to find other ways to try and guarantee his political future.Puerile, crude, misogynistic, and always outrageous: Ali G Indahouse, the big-screen debut outing for Sascha Baron Cohen's middle-class Berkshire gangsta, is all of these things and much moremeaning it's my kind of film!

It 's just that . Chucky 1 was good . Chucky 2 was better . Chucky 3 sucked . Now Chucky 4 has been released and it is, surprisingly, back to being enjoyable again. The franchise took a twist by incorporating an interesting storyline and finally balanced the humor and horror aspects quite well. It feels like the series learned from its previous mistakes and evolved, keeping its loyal fans on their toes while capturing new audiences. Nevertheless, as sequels continue to emerge, maintaining the essence of the original while making unique content seems to be the eternal challenge for Chucky and many other iconic film franchises.

I remember this film of old. It's a great, chilling, atmospheric horror picture about a man who moves into a Scottish castle, only to discover that there are strange goings-on in the corridors at night. And there are even stranger events taking place out back, in Hollywood's most familiar hedge maze. Yes, this is the maze you've seen in every feature-length film that ever involved a topiary puzzle, up to and including "The Shining." But the punchline to this story is about the last thing you would guess. I certainly didn't see it coming.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse.' In this hilarious film adaptation of Sacha Baron Cohen's famous character, we follow Ali G as he inadvertently becomes embroiled in the high-stakes world of politics, ultimately serving as a Member of Parliament. Expect cringeworthy and rib-tickling scenarios, complete with the tongue-in-cheek and over-the-top humor Ali G is known for. Much like the original TV show, 'Ali G Indahouse' is controversial yet laugh-out-loud funny, offering biting social commentary disguised as comical absurdity.

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

The best thing from the American Pie `` bakery . '' I found the humor and the plot to be utterly relatable and downright hilarious. The characters are charmingly realistic, each showcasing distinct personalities that blend so well together, resulting in memorable and comedic situations throughout the film. What makes American Pie truly exceptional is its ability to effortlessly touch on the anxieties, dreams, and awkward moments that come with teenage years, evoking a sense of nostalgia in its audience. Moreover, the infusion of humor allows it to tackle sensitive subjects with levity, giving the audience the perfect blend of laughter and thought-provoking content.

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

by TyNesha Mells. In this drama, Ja Rule, who stars as Reggie, struggles with the loss of his father. His old friend J-Bone, who is a cold-blooded thug recently released from prison, helps Reggie find who murdered his father. A week after his dad died, a preacher, Reverend Packer, came up dead. Reggie was suppose to be the one to kill him, but did he? Did Reggie kill Reverend Packer or was it some type of a setup? Back in the Day also has a couple of romantic scenes.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol' says it all. I used to watch this movie all the time as a kid; and even then I sensed the silliness of it all. The low budget, horrible acting and lame script was ever apparent back then. I watched it again yesterday and just couldn't stop laughing. It's so bad it's actually good lol. Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

Due to its predictable, second-rate title, (the one it was distributed under in Italy, at least) I didn't expect much from this movie. Thought it'd be another cheap flick about a haunted house ("LA CASA MALEDETTA" means "The cursed house"). Well, I had to change my mind just after the very first brilliant scene! The constant presence of priests and the creepy atmospheres, reminded me a bit of The Exorcist and some of its decent Italian rip-offs, but this was going to be something completely different...

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency. Putney Swope is on the board for no other reason than the fact that he is black, and the agency needs a "token" on the board. Swope is ignoring the meeting, reading Jet magazine at the big table, and everybody is ignoring Swope... Suddenly, the CEO croaks on the spot. No time is wasted. A janitor is called to haul off the corpse, and the board immediately and unceremoniously tackles the business of electing a new CEO.

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's a lighthearted action-comedy, full of amusing scenes and a dose of friendly banter. Despite its conventional cop-buddy storyline, the pairing of Eddie Murphy's quick wit and Robert DeNiro's experienced charm elevate the film's entertainment value. Viewers get to experience both their acting prowess as they work to bring down a criminal kingpin. Ultimately, Showtime serves as a fun-filled trip down memory lane, a celebration of the early 2000s Hollywood era, and an opportunity to enjoy the undeniable chemistry of these two great talents.

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

First off, I absolutely loved this movie. As a Billy Crystal fan, I must say that I was expecting more comedic situations than I actually got. However, it was nice to see him in a role with more depth and emotion. His portrayal of talent agent Sammy was brilliantly performed and uniquely him. In addition, Gheorghe Muresan (as Maximus) was superb in his first film role. When Sammy goes to Romania to visit his client on location he has his world turned upside down. He never expected that he would accidentally find the one person who could change his life.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . It perfectly combines an enchanting storyline with mesmerizing musical numbers, delivering a cinematic masterpiece that stands the test of time. Featuring a remarkable cast and stunning choreography, Lost Horizon takes its audience on a delightful and entertaining journey, exploring profound themes such as love, adventure, and the search for inner peace. Overflowing with charm, wit, and an array of memorable songs, this legendary movie has rightfully earned its place as an all-time favorite for movie enthusiasts and musical connoisseurs alike.

No real plot, no character development, no Scorcese-level direction, but seriously, were you really expecting any of this? The only thing that matters is that this flick is absolutely hilarious, nearly on the same level as Borat. Sure, the ending drags a bit, but if Borat's cameo didn't crack you up, you must be the worst batty boy in the history of batty boys. Sacha Baron Cohen is possibly the greatest comedian ALIVE, and here he gets more laughs than Jude Law on a nude beach.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts . But it will put butts in seats, thanks to its captivating storyline, stellar cast, and outstanding visual effects. Even if some viewers complain about the liberties taken with historical accuracy, the primary goal of any movie is to entertain and capture an audience. This film more than meets that standard by weaving a gripping and emotionally charged narrative that can even serve as a starting point for people who become interested in digging into the real-life story.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.
