He must go on the run, and ends up out in the sticks with Gloria Dickson and the Dead End Kids. Here is offered a chance for redemption, yet will the past catch up with him yet? Garfield was an actor ahead of his peers.

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old. I had no idea who Buddy Holly was, nor can I remember what it was that made me sit down in front of the television, tuned in to HBO, and watch this engaging biopic. What I remember was realizing that it was a (somewhat) true story, about someone who actually lived. I recall the music, great songs that I still love today (I can't believe Gary Busey sang his own songs and so well - What a stud!) Then, came the end.

the first time I saw this movie, I just thought "what the hell?" a 10-year-old kid driving around bizarre places, meeting bizarre people, going after a game called MOTORAMA! Hell yeah! I enjoyed this movie a lot!Jordan Christopher-Michael is a brilliant young actor! It's a shame he stopped act. He interprets very well his character Gus on the movie.Gus loses an eye, got tattoos and go at the most weird cities acting with Flea, Drew Barrymore and Meat Loaf! Want more? OK, don't even try to understand the story, but why this movie needs one!?

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to share my thoughts on both these classic Disney animations with friends and family. The Aristocats, with its lovable cat characters and heartwarming storyline, provided a delightful blast from the past. Meanwhile, The Fox and the Hound offered an emotional exploration of an unlikely friendship tested by societal norms. These timeless stories impart important life lessons on love, loyalty, and acceptance that can be cherished by viewers of all ages. With their catchy tunes and endearing characters, these films make an excellent addition to anyone's Disney collection.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

This new installment to the Child's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as a stoner witnessing Chucky giveing him the finger and saying "rude f--king doll" and lots of references to the series: "you can kill me but I'll come back. I always come back". The movie's title was probably thought of before the script and was written around it. This is totally different from all other films in the series. It doesn't even have Andy, the central character for all the previous ones.

I 'm not going to go into too much depth , but Showtime was a pretty funny movie . There were moments where I found myself genuinely laughing at some of the ridiculous antics the characters get up to. Robert De Niro and Eddie Murphy make a great on-screen duo with their completely contrasting personalities, providing some witty banter throughout the film. While it doesn't necessarily have the most compelling plot or depth in character development, Showtime more than makes up for it in pure comedic value. The buddy cop aspect gives the film a comfortable familiarity that makes it enjoyable to watch for any casual viewer.

This movie is beautiful in all ways. It is visually stunning, and this is a good thing since the dialogue would only take up a page or two of paper. The acting is superb; it is subtle, passionate and intense. Ben Daniels does a fabulous job of turning himself into an animal, and mixing that wild nature with a man's overbearing passion and honor. There is not one flaw, not one mistake or wrong moment to be found anywhere. It is completely perfect, but only if you understand what you're going to experience.

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a déjà vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

As a film buff , I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny , sarcastic comments about this so-called cinematic masterpiece. With popcorn in hand and a cautiously optimistic attitude, I entered the movie theater, wondering if it was going to live up to the hype. To my delight, the movie completely exceeded my expectations. Despite the nitpicking from certain film critics and their eye-rolling remarks, I found the story to be engrossing, thought-provoking, and downright thrilling. The rich character development paired with stunning visuals transported me into a mesmerizing new world.

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons, and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out. I must admit, season one is by far the most underrated season, and this is the most underrated episode in season one.The episode begins with the family playing a game of Scrabble to get Bart ready for an intelligence test he needs to take at school. He says the game is stupid and he doesn't want to play it, but he needs to. He spells out a word that angers Homer and he chases Bart around the house.

A mix of 70's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line. As I've often said about this flick - if you don't get it - you're way lame..... Classic lines such as (parapharsed) "I've got this erection and it won't go away no matter how many times I do it. You're a nurse, what can you give me for it?" Nurse replies "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." Great sound track.The classic "Hyde's got nothing to hide".

In Nordestina, a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco, Antônio (Gustavo Falcão) is the youngest son of his mother, who had uninterruptedly cried for five years. When he is a young man, he falls in love for Karina (Mariana Ximenes), a seventeen years old teenager that dreams to see the world and becomes an actress. Antônio promises Karina to bring the world to Nordestina, and once in Rio de Janeiro, he participates of a sensationalist television show and promises to travel to the fifty years ahead in the future or die for love with a deadly machine he had invented.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

`` D.O.A '' is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish . Dennis Quaid is at his best as a college professor who, after being exposed to a deadly toxin, is left with only 24 hours to live. In a desperate race against time, he must find his own killer before the poison takes his life. Filled with intrigue and thrilling moments, this neo-noir thriller showcases Quaid's versatile acting chops as he navigates the dark and suspenseful world the story presents. Along the way, characters reveal layers of depth and sinister motives, ultimately leading to a heart-pounding, captivating conclusion that will leave the audience breathless.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort , and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. At the height of his fame, he used his celebrity status to raise awareness about the conflict and its consequences. Known for his silent films featuring the beloved character of The Tramp, Chaplin organized fundraisers, and produced several war-themed movies to show the heroism and sacrifices made by soldiers on the battlefield. He even used his influence to address critical wartime issues such as rationing and civil defense through comedic performances. All this contributed significantly to maintaining the morale and inspiring support for the allied forces during World War II.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie , this wo n't be one for you . If you want something genuine, gripping, and thought-provoking, then this film is a breath of fresh air in a saturated genre. Brilliant performances, solid script, and skillful direction work together to immerse you in a thrilling, emotionally resonant experience. Gone are the clichéd one-liners and cheesy explosions, replaced with authentic characters, intelligent dialogue, and gritty action sequences. A masterpiece that revitalizes a tired industry, this movie demands attention and awards equal parts heart-stopping moments and poignant insights into the human condition.

I always liked this movie , I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it : ) This movie never gets old for me; it has everything - great acting, a well-crafted plot, and powerful dialogues. I often find new, subtle details that make each viewing even more engaging. Plus, its stellar cast manages to create genuine chemistry that pulls me into the story every single time. Even after watching it so many times, the emotional scenes still give me goosebumps and put a smile on my face. It has definitely secured a special place in my list of all-time favorite movies!

I just ca n't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense . It was never supposed to make sense in the first place! It's a mind-bending, genre-defying piece of experimental cinema, designed to make audiences think and question the conventional tropes we've become so used to. You should expect to be shocked, bewildered, and perhaps even frustrated by the various plot twists and lack of concrete answers. Embrace the ambiguity and appreciate it as a unique experience meant to challenge our perceptions of film as an art form.

"Don't Torture a Duckling" is one of the coolest Italian horror films I've ever seen, and I've seen my share. To call it a giallo is a little misleading because it's not really a typical murder mystery. It's more of a straight horror movie.Complete with one of the most brutal and gory scenes ever in a movie this old, Fulci's twisting and turning film oozes with a creepy ambiance and an old school Italian feel. The setting is perfect: an old Italian village. The music is ridiculously perfect.

I'm not a massive Disney fan, but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so we've built up quite a collection, and this is one of my favourites. We first saw this a couple of weeks ago and we must have see it half a dozen times since! OK, as others have pointed out, not the most complex or inventive of plots, but there's more to a film than that.Great characters, Phil Harris stealing the show as Thomas O'Malley, but Edgar the butler not far behind.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

Well , I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning . And so, after browsing countless recommendations, I stumbled upon a hidden gem with rave reviews. Excitement welled within me as I settled in for what I hoped would be an exhilarating experience. The lights dimmed and the opening scene unfolded; from that moment, I was enthralled. The brilliantly-woven storyline, the engaging characters, and the gripping plot twists held me captive from start to finish. And as the credits rolled, I realized that, at long last, I had found the captivating cinematic masterpiece I had been seeking.

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war. Everything about the movie was perfect. I just saw the movie yesterday and I want to get my own DVD asap and watch it many times over. The story ends as it started I was very happy that he came back and I was proud of her for becoming a doctor and fulfilling her father's dream. She honored her father, boyfriend-husband, and her lover. The character had many shades. Christian Bale is also an phenomenal actor. Some stories do have happy endings.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from ! For a low-budget film, I must admit, it surprisingly exceeded my expectations. The captivating storyline, combined with decent acting and brilliant cinematography, made the film thoroughly enjoyable. It effectively transported me to a new world, leaving me emotionally invested in the well-developed characters. Although it's not a big-name production, the overall quality made for a refreshing change from mainstream cinema. I am incredibly grateful to the lady who suggested this gem; it has opened my eyes to discovering lesser-known but deserving movies.

First of all, around the time I wrote this comment, I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written about this game and was confused. This is a video game and not an actual movie. I mean, I myself would choose a good Deniro movie or playing a video game any day. But, dude, what are you talking about? Now that I have that out of the way, let's move on, shall we? The video game adaption of Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon is, as you may have guessed, based on the movie of the same name.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave. I'm happy with that, as a big fan of horror, and I liked most of those new horror films. BOC is a one big pack of horror. Colorful, fast paced and original. I see this movie more like the opening of a new trilogy (much like Episode 1 and Aliens: Resurrection) since it comes up with a new twist. Instead of focusing on the little boy-killer doll relationship we have here a twisted movie about couples. We have the sweet young lovers in contrast with the killer crazy doll-sized lovers.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in South Africa during the apartheid era. This inspiring movie unravels the deeply rooted racial tensions and challenges faced by those fighting for justice, equality, and an end to the racial divide. In Final Solution, we witness the harrowing impact of apartheid on people's lives as it explores themes of love, forgiveness, and redemption through faith. We follow a black activist who works alongside white sympathizers to overcome their prejudice, whilst constantly encountering oppression and suffering.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a high-end event probably has some seriously skewed priorities. Like, seriously, what are you even trying to achieve with this kind of desperate measure? Are you so determined to blend into high society that you'll willingly compromise your safety, sanity, and mobility just to earn a few impressed glances? I don't know about you, but that level of superficiality just baffles me. There has to be a better way to make meaningful connections and find fulfillment, without sacrificing our humanity in the pursuit of extravagance.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie . I caught it last night on TMC . I have to admit I had never heard of this movie. I caught it last night on TMC and was pleasantly surprised by how engaging it was. The plot was well-paced and intriguing, capturing my attention from start to finish. The actors delivered strong performances, adding depth to their respective characters. Additionally, the cinematography and score blended seamlessly, creating a captivating ambiance. Despite my initial lack of awareness about the film, I'm truly glad I stumbled upon it – I definitely plan on recommending it to my friends.

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since the breathtaking cinematography effortlessly immerses the viewer into its richly detailed and meticulously crafted world. The film's talented cast delivers outstanding and emotionally resonant performances, pulling the audience in with an intoxicating blend of relatable characters and thought-provoking themes. The carefully structured narrative deftly unfolds a compelling story, full of heart, depth, and clever twists that continuously captivate and challenge expectations. Furthermore, the evocative score superbly complements each scene, stirring a deeply emotional connection that lingers long after the credits have rolled.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly ( 1936-59 ) . He does have a striking resemblance to the iconic musician and his on-screen charisma truly brought Buddy Holly to life. Busey's dedicated performance, where he actually sang and played guitar, not only showcased his versatile acting talent, but also helped portray Holly's groundbreaking talent and artistry. The 1978 biographical film "The Buddy Holly Story" garnered critical acclaim and award nominations, with Busey's outstanding performance receiving well-deserved accolades. Ultimately, the film remains a memorable testament to Buddy Holly's indelible impact on rock-n-roll history, with Busey honoring his legacy.

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it . It is just not available anywhere, neither online streaming platforms nor physical copies at local video stores. Recently, I found it on a long-forgotten film collectors' forum, and it was a dream come true! This movie not only brings back sweet memories of the time when I first watched it, but it also boasts an excellent plot, captivating storytelling, and impressive acting from all the cast members. It reminds me of the charm old films have - raw and unpolished yet undeniably alluring.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it . I found the storyline unsettling and the visuals to be haunting. Nevertheless, it stayed with me throughout the years, ingrained in my memory, like an unsolvable puzzle demanding to be resolved. Recently, I decided to revisit it and was surprised to find that my perspective had drastically changed. As an adult, I appreciated the underlying themes and metaphors of the film, which had once left me disturbed. I was able to analyze the complexities and nuances embedded within the characters and the storyline.

Ah the Outer Limits . I love that show . It was surpremely creepy , or down-right mysterious . I cherish those days when the intro alone used to send shivers down my spine. Those twisted and innovative plotlines often gave my overactive imagination ample content for nightmares, but still kept me coming back for more. From alien encounters to mysterious parallel universes, the Outer Limits never ceased to provoke the sense of unknown within our universe, all while leaving viewers questioning their perception of reality. The show undeniably left an indelible impact on its audience, and I, for one, miss that era of groundbreaking science-fiction.

I 've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie . I agree with most of the reviews that the movie had its shortcomings. The adaptation could have been stronger, as the characters were underdeveloped, leaving viewers somewhat disconnected. The visuals were a commendable effort for that era, but the lack of impactful storytelling failed to bring James Hilton's book to life in the way one would expect. Moreover, the pacing felt dragged, and some scenes seemed redundant. Despite a stellar cast and intriguing premise, Lost Horizons sadly couldn't achieve the greatness it aimed for due to these issues.

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could ever want from a dark, twisted psychological thriller. The script is ingeniously crafted, leaving the viewers constantly questioning the reality that unfolds before their eyes. The performances by the lead actors are equally chilling and mesmerizing, skillfully delving into the darkest corners of human emotion. Visually, the film exudes a gloomy atmosphere, emphasizing the theme of uncertainty and paranoia. Maybe the complexities might have made it inaccessible to some audiences, but in my opinion, this overlooked gem deserves a much higher rating and greater appreciation from film enthusiasts.

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.
